ResourceHeader.ResourceName: TIMED GUVI L2B Neutral Density Profiles
ResourceHeader.Description: O2, N2, and O neutral density profiles over an orbit as a function of latitude and altitude derived from GUVI OI 135.6 nm and N2 LBH short and long radiance profiles.

AccessURL.Name: GUVI POC L2B Neutral Density Product (IDLsave) Data Request
AccessURL.Description: This web page allows the request of data files for this product. To request data: select the year and day then press display.

Parameter.Name: Atomic Oxygen Number Density
Parameter.Description: Retrieved values of atomic oxygen number density from the inversion process
Parameter.Caveats: Note that the retrieved densities and temperatures are given for the full zm (110 - 667 km) altitude range. But the highest accuracy is due to sensitivity of the dayglow between about 150 and 300 km to the parameters. So densities outside of that altitude range should be viewed as extrapolations of the best-fit model within that interval. However, our initial comparisons with total mass densities above 400 km from satellite drag and accelerometers show good agreement with the GUVI retrievals?a very promising result. If any of the elements in the FLAG parameter are set, retrievals should be used with caution, or preferably not used at all

Structure.Description: Dimensions: [n,i] - where n is the number of levels in a limb scan (n is nominally 21); i is the number of limb scans (i.e., records) in an orbital file (n is approximately 100).

Parameter.Name: Molecular Oxygen Number Density

Structure.Description: Dimensions: [n,i] - where n is the number of levels in a limb scan (n is nominally 21); i is the number of limb scans (i.e., records) in an orbital file (i is approximately 100).

Parameter.Name: Uncertainty in Atomic Oxygen Number Density
Parameter.Description: 1-sigma uncertainty in atomic oxygen number density

Structure.Description: Dimensions: [n,i] - where n is the number of levels in a limb scan (n is nominally 21); i is the number of limb scans (i.e., records) in an orbital file (i is approximately 100).

Parameter.Description: 1-sigma uncertainty in molecular oxygen number density

Parameter.Name: Uncertainty in Temperature
Parameter.Description: 1-sigma uncertainty in temperature

Structure.Description: Dimensions: [n,i] - where n is the number of levels in a limb scan (n is nominally 21); i is the number of limb scans (i.e., records) in an orbital file (i is approximately 100).

Parameter.Name: Qeuv
Parameter.Description: The solar energy flux from the TIMED/SEE data. Multiply Qeuv by MORBIT(0).M(4) x MORBIT(0).M(7) to obtain the solar flux required to fit the GUVI dayglow.

Structure.Description: Dimensions: [i] - where i is the number of limb scans (i.e., records) in an orbital file (i is approximately 100).

Parameter.Name: Altitude
Parameter.Description: Altitude grid in model

Structure.Description: Dimensions: [n,i] - where n is the number of levels in a limb scan (n is nominally 21); i is the number of limb scans (i.e., records) in an orbital file (i is approximately 100).

Parameter.Name: O/N2 column ratio
Parameter.Description: O/N2 column ratio computed from retrieved O and N2 densities

Structure.Description: Dimensions: [i] - where i is the number of limb scans (i.e., records) in an orbital file (i is approximately 100).

Parameter.Name: NRLMSIS Atomic Oxygen Number Density
Parameter.Description: Values of atomic oxygen number density from the output of the NRLMIS model predictions
Parameter.Caveats: Note that the retrieved densities and temperatures are given for the full zm (110 - 667 km) altitude range. But the highest accuracy is due to sensitivity of the dayglow between about 150 and 300 km to the parameters. So densities outside of that altitude range should be viewed as extrapolations of the best-fit model within that interval. However, our initial comparisons with total mass densities above 400 km from satellite drag and accelerometers show good agreement with the GUVI retrievals?a very promising result. If any of the elements in the FLAG parameter are set, retrievals should be used with caution, or preferably not used at all

Parameter.Name: NRLMSIS Temperature
Parameter.Description: Values of temperature from the ioutput of the NRLMIS model predictions
Parameter.Caveats: Note that the retrieved densities and temperatures are given for the full zm (110 - 667 km) altitude range. But the highest accuracy is due to sensitivity of the dayglow between about 150 and 300 km to the parameters. So densities outside of that altitude range should be viewed as extrapolations of the best-fit model within that interval. However, our initial comparisons with total mass densities above 400 km from satellite drag and accelerometers show good agreement with the GUVI retrievals?a very promising result. If any of the elements in the FLAG parameter are set, retrievals should be used with caution, or preferably not used at all

Structure.Description: Dimensions: [n,i] - where n is the number of levels in a limb scan (n is nominally 21); i is the number of limb scans (i.e., records) in an orbital file (i is approximately 100).

Parameter.Name: NRLMSIS O/N2 column ratio
Parameter.Description: O/N2 column ratio computed from NRLMSIS O and N2 densities

Structure.Description: Dimensions: [i] - where i is the number of limb scans (i.e., records) in an orbital file (i is approximately 100).

Parameter.Name: Iteration steps
Parameter.Description: The number of retrieval iteration steps for a given limb scan

Structure.Description: Dimensions: [i] - where i is the number of limb scans (i.e., records) in an orbital file (i is approximately 100).

Parameter.Name: Data Quality Flag
Parameter.Description: Data quality flag of the retrieved values of densities and temperatures from the inversion process. Most data with flags set to 1 have been removed.

Structure.Description: Dimensions: (3, n, i), where 3 is a 3-element vector; n is a n-level profile (nominally n is 21); and i is the number of limb scans (i.e., records) in an orbital file (i is approximately 100).

Element.Name: flag_0
Element.UnitsConversion: A value of zero means the retrieval was nominal; a value of one means the number of iteration steps for a given limb scan reached 20 without convergence in the retrieval process.

Element.Name: flag_1
Element.UnitsConversion: A value of zero means the retrieval was nominal; a value of one means any of the model parameters hit the a priori upper and lower limits.

Element.Name: flag_2
Element.UnitsConversion: A value of zero means the retrieval was nominal; a value of one means the altitude of peak intensity was too close to a boundary.

Parameter.Name: Day of year
Parameter.Description: The day of year of the limb scan

Structure.Description: Dimensions: [i] - where i is the number of limb scans (i.e., records) in an orbital file (i is approximately 100).

Parameter.Name: Seconds of day
Parameter.Description: The UT seconds of day of the limb scan

Structure.Description: Dimensions: [i] - where i is the number of limb scans (i.e., records) in an orbital file (i is approximately 100).

Parameter.Name: Geolocated latitude
Parameter.Description: The geolocated latitude of the limb scan assigned to the tangent point near the peak of the airglow layer, roughly 160 km

Structure.Description: Dimensions: [i] - where i is the number of limb scans (i.e., records) in an orbital file (i is approximately 100).

Parameter.Name: Geolocated longitude
Parameter.Description: The geolocated longitude of the limb scan assigned to the tangent point near the peak of the airglow layer, roughly 160 km

Structure.Description: Dimensions: [i] - where i is the number of limb scans (i.e., records) in an orbital file (i is approximately 100).

Parameter.Name: Solar time
Parameter.Description: The solar time of the limb scan

Structure.Description: Dimensions: [i] - where i is the number of limb scans (i.e., records) in an orbital file (i is approximately 100).

Parameter.Name: Averaged f10.7
Parameter.Description: The 81-day average of the observed solar 10.7-cm radio flux as recorded by DRAO at Pentiction, British Columbia, Canada, at 2000 UT.

Structure.Description: Dimensions: [i] - where i is the number of limb scans (i.e., records) in an orbital file (i is approximately 100).

Parameter.Name: Previous-day f10.7
Parameter.Description: The previous-day observed solar 10.7-cm radio flux as recorded by DRAO at Pentiction, British Columbia, Canada, at 2000 UT.

Structure.Description: Dimensions: [i] - where i is the number of limb scans (i.e., records) in an orbital file (i is approximately 100).

Parameter.Name: f10.7
Parameter.Description: The current-day observed solar 10.7-cm radio flux as recorded by DRAO at Pentiction, British Columbia, Canada, at 2000 UT.

Structure.Description: Dimensions: [i] - where i is the number of limb scans (i.e., records) in an orbital file (i is approximately 100).

Parameter.Name: Ap
Parameter.Description: The current-day daily geomagnetic Ap index.

Structure.Description: Dimensions: [i] - where i is the number of limb scans (i.e., records) in an orbital file (i is approximately 100).

Parameter.Name: Solar zenith angle
Parameter.Description: The solar zenith angle at the geolocated tangent point.

Structure.Description: Dimensions: [i] - where i is the number of limb scans (i.e., records) in an orbital file (i is approximately 100).

Parameter.Name: Model parameters structure
Parameter.Description: A structure containing the model parameters and other information and constraints. Components are M, an array of model parameters, which are retrieved from the inversion process; MINIT, an array of initial guesses of the parameter vector, M ; NAME, an array containing the string name of the model parameter; CHANGE, an array indicating the parameters that are allowed to vary during the inversion process, LOWERLIMIT, an array indicating the lower limits of the parameter, UPPERLIMIT, an array indicating the upper limits of the parameter, COVFIT, a covariance matrix for the retrieved model parameters.

Structure.Description: Dimensions: [i] - where i is the number of limb scans (i.e., records) in an orbital file (i is approximately 100).

Parameter.Name: Data structure
Parameter.Description: A structure containing the data, retrieved fits, and other information. Components are DIN, an array of the original data; NAME, an array containing the name of the measured intensity (eg, 1356 or LBH); D, an array containing the best fit model intensities; D0, an array containing the intensities computed using the initial guess parameters; ALT, an array containing the tangent altitudes for the intensities; COVDATA, an array containing the covariance of the data.

Structure.Description: Dimensions: [i] - where i is the number of limb scans (i.e., records) in an orbital file (i is approximately 100).
